verses.plain: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?

tokens.t: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?

verses.plain: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the LORD, and against his anointed, saying,

tokens.t: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the
, and against his anointed,

verses.plain: Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.

tokens.t: Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.

verses.plain: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.

tokens.t: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.

verses.plain: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.

tokens.t: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.

verses.plain: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.

tokens.t: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.

verses.plain: I will declare the decree: the LORD hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.

tokens.t: I will declare the decree: the
hath said unto me, Thou
my Son; this day have I begotten thee.

verses.plain: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.

tokens.t: Ask of me, and I shall give
the heathen
thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth
thy possession.

verses.plain: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.

tokens.t: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.

verses.plain: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.

tokens.t: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.

verses.plain: Serve the LORD with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

tokens.t: Serve the
with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

verses.plain: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.

tokens.t: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish
the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed
all they that put their trust in him.

footnotes.text: upon…: Heb. upon Zion, the hill of my holiness
the decree: or, for a decree
